intro: Lobelia buchananii, commonly known as Buchanan's lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist to wet soil conditions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Lobelia buchananii is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
